api.description: The Clash Detection API allows you to manage clash detection suppression rules, tests, runs, and results. You can run tests and monitor the progress.

items.name: get-clashdetection-result
items.description:
---

Gets the clash detection result details for the specified result id.

- Discover result ids by calling [GET /clashdetection/runs](/api-groups/validation/apis/clash-detection/operations/get-clashdetection-runs/)

### Authentication

Requires `Authorization` header with valid Bearer token for scope `itwin-platform`.

For more documentation on authorization and how to get access token visit [OAUTH2 Authorization](https://developer.bentley.com/apis/overview/authorization/) page.

---

responses.description: OK

This response indicates that request lacks valid authentication credentials. Access token might not been provided, issued by the wrong issuer, does not have required scopes or request headers were malformed.
This response indicates that the specified result was not found.

headers.name: retry-after
headers.description: The number of requests exceeds the rate-limit for the client subscription.

responses.description: This response indicates that the user has sent too many requests in a given amount of time.

items.name: get-clashdetection-runs
items.description:
---

Retrieves a list of Clash Detection runs for the project specified by the project id.

### Notes

The Prefer header can be used to specify how much clash detection run metadata is desired

- "return=minimal" (default) - returns the minimum clash detection run metadata

- "return=representation" - returns the full clash detection run metadata

### Authentication

Requires `Authorization` header with valid Bearer token for scope `itwin-platform`.

For more documentation on authorization and how to get access token visit [OAUTH2 Authorization](https://developer.bentley.com/apis/overview/authorization/) page.

---

parameters.name: projectId
parameters.description: The project id of the project from which to retrieve the clash detection runs.

queryParameters.name: projectId
queryParameters.description: The project id of the project from which to retrieve the clash detection runs.

responses.description: OK

This response indicates that request lacks valid authentication credentials. Access token might not been provided, issued by the wrong issuer, does not have required scopes or request headers were malformed.
This response indicates that the specified project was not found.

headers.name: retry-after
headers.description: The number of requests exceeds the rate-limit for the client subscription.

responses.description: This response indicates that the user has sent too many requests in a given amount of time.

items.name: run-clashdetection-test
items.description:
---

Runs a Clash Detection test for the specified test id and returns the run id. The maximum number of clashes may be specified with the resultsLimit parameter in the request body. If none is specified, the default is 100,000.

- This API has a rate limit of 6 API calls per second.  If an application exceeds the rate limit it will receive an HTTP error code 429 "Too Many Requests". The error response includes a Retry-After header that indicates how long clients should wait before retrying.

- A link is included to retrieve the run status as the agent job completes asynchronously.

- Discover test ids by calling [GET /clashdetection/tests](/api-groups/validation/apis/clash-detection/operations/get-clashdetection-tests/)

- Discover iModel ids by calling [GET /imodels](/api-groups/data-management/apis/imodels/operations/get-project-imodels/)

- Discover named version ids by calling [GET /imodels/{id}/namedversions](/api-groups/data-management/apis/imodels/operations/get-imodel-named-versions/)

### Authentication

Requires `Authorization` header with valid Bearer token for scope `itwin-platform`.

For more documentation on authorization and how to get access token visit [OAUTH2 Authorization](https://developer.bentley.com/apis/overview/authorization/) page.

---

responses.description: Created

This response indicates that request lacks valid authentication credentials. Access token might not been provided, issued by the wrong issuer, does not have required scopes or request headers were malformed.
This response indicates that the specified test was not found.
The 422 (Unprocessable Entity) status code indicates that the request cannot be processed by the server due to a client error (e.g. malformed request syntax)

headers.name: retry-after
headers.description: The number of requests exceeds the rate-limit for the client subscription.

responses.description: This response indicates that the user has sent too many requests in a given amount of time.

items.name: get-clashdetection-suppression-rules
items.description:
---

Retrieves a list of clash detection suppression rules for the project specified by the project id.

### Notes

The Prefer header can be used to specify how much rule metadata is desired

- "return=minimal" (default) - returns the minimum suppression rule metadata

- "return=representation" - returns the full suppression rule metadata

### Authentication

Requires `Authorization` header with valid Bearer token for scope `itwin-platform`.

For more documentation on authorization and how to get access token visit [OAUTH2 Authorization](https://developer.bentley.com/apis/overview/authorization/) page.

---

parameters.name: projectId
parameters.description: The project id of the project from which to retrieve clash detection suppression rules.

parameters.name: continuationToken
parameters.description: Parameter that enables continuing to the next page of the previous paged query. This must be passed exactly as it is in the response body's _links.next property. If this is specified and $top is omitted, the next page will be the same size as the previous page.

parameters.name: $top
parameters.description: The number of rules to get in each page. Max 50, but 10 is the default if this parameter is not included.

queryParameters.name: projectId
queryParameters.description: The project id of the project from which to retrieve clash detection suppression rules.

queryParameters.name: continuationToken
queryParameters.description: Parameter that enables continuing to the next page of the previous paged query. This must be passed exactly as it is in the response body's _links.next property. If this is specified and $top is omitted, the next page will be the same size as the previous page.

queryParameters.name: $top
queryParameters.description: The number of rules to get in each page. Max 50, but 10 is the default if this parameter is not included.

headers.name: Include-User-Metadata
headers.description: Optional. Include user metadata when true.

responses.description: OK

items.name: create-clashdetection-tests
items.description:
---

Creates clash detection test for the specified criteria and returns the test id.

- Discover rule ids by calling [GET /clashdetection/suppressionrules](/api-groups/validation/apis/clash-detection/operations/get-clashdetection-suppression-rules/)

### Authentication

Requires `Authorization` header with valid Bearer token for scope `itwin-platform`.

For more documentation on authorization and how to get access token visit [OAUTH2 Authorization](https://developer.bentley.com/apis/overview/authorization/) page.

---

representations.example:
{
    "projectId": "38b7e366-bc20-4bb1-9572-0797cf5221fd",
    "displayName": "Test4",
    "description": "test 4",
    "setA": {
        "modelIds": [
            "0x21",
            "0x66",
            "0x68",
            "0x6a",
            "0x6c"
        ],
        "categoryIds": [],
        "selfCheck": true,
        "clearance": 0.001
    },
    "setB": {
        "modelIds": [],
        "categoryIds": [],
        "selfCheck": false,
        "clearance": 0
    },
    "suppressTouching": false,
    "touchingTolerance": 0,
    "includeSubModels": false,
    "suppressionRules": [
        "ZuO3OCC8sUuVcgeXz1Ih_Z44rgIyaT1Nia7oxeYeNew"
    ],
    "advancedSettings": {
        "longClash": true,
        "calculateOverlap": false,
        "toleranceOverlapValidation": false
    }
}

---

Updates a clash detection test for the specified criteria and returns the id of the successfully updated test.

- Discover test ids by calling [GET /clashdetection/tests](/api-groups/validation/apis/clash-detection/operations/get-clashdetection-tests/)

- Discover rule ids by calling [GET /clashdetection/suppressionrules](/api-groups/validation/apis/clash-detection/operations/get-clashdetection-suppression-rules/)

For more documentation on authorization and how to get access token visit [OAUTH2 Authorization](https://developer.bentley.com/apis/overview/authorization/) page.

items.name: extract-models-and-categories
items.description:
---

Extracts the models and categories for the latest named version of an iModel.

- A status of 202 is returned if the extraction job was successfully started.  The job completes asynchronously so the user can periodically call [GET /clashdetection/modelsAndCategories/imodels](/api-groups/data-management/apis/clash-detection/operations/get-models-and-categories/) until a status of 'available' is returned with the response.

- Discover iModel ids by calling [GET /imodels](/api-groups/data-management/apis/imodels/operations/get-project-imodels/)

### Authentication

Requires `Authorization` header with valid Bearer token for scope `itwin-platform`.

For more documentation on authorization and how to get access token visit [OAUTH2 Authorization](https://developer.bentley.com/apis/overview/authorization/) page.

---

responses.description: Accepted

This response indicates that request lacks valid authentication credentials. Access token might not been provided, issued by the wrong issuer, does not have required scopes or request headers were malformed.
This response indicates that the specified iModel or project was not found.
The 422 (Unprocessable Entity) status code indicates that the request cannot be processed by the server due to a client error (e.g. malformed request syntax)

headers.name: retry-after
headers.description: The number of requests exceeds the rate-limit for the client subscription.

responses.description: This response indicates that the user has sent too many requests in a given amount of time.

items.name: get-models-and-categories
items.description:
---

Gets the models and categories for the named version of an iModel. This request relies on a previous call to start the extraction job on an agent. Since this extraction completes asynchronously, the user can send this request periodically until a status of 'available' is returned in the response.

- Discover iModel ids by calling [GET /imodels](/api-groups/data-management/apis/imodels/operations/get-project-imodels/)

- Extract iModel models and categories by calling [POST /clashdetection/modelsAndCategories/imodels](/api-groups/validation/apis/clash-detection/operations/extract-models-and-categories/)

### Authentication

Requires `Authorization` header with valid Bearer token for scope `itwin-platform`.

For more documentation on authorization and how to get access token visit [OAUTH2 Authorization](https://developer.bentley.com/apis/overview/authorization/) page.

---

parameters.name: projectId
parameters.description: The id of the project containing the iModel from which to retrieve the models and categories.

queryParameters.name: projectId
queryParameters.description: The id of the project containing the iModel from which to retrieve the models and categories.

responses.description: OK

This response indicates that request lacks valid authentication credentials. Access token might not been provided, issued by the wrong issuer, does not have required scopes or request headers were malformed.
This response indicates that the specified iModel or project was not found.

headers.name: retry-after
headers.description: The number of requests exceeds the rate-limit for the client subscription.

responses.description: This response indicates that the user has sent too many requests in a given amount of time.
